oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Zollicoffer Barracks - Maxwell House Hotel
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Construction of the Maxwell House Hotel was not completed when Federal troops seized the building for use as a prison for Confederate soldiers. The cornerstone was laid in August of 1860, and the formal opening was in September of 1869. Isaiah Rogers, of Cincinnati, was the architect. 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nashville (Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: CDM 013; The Official History of the Tennessee Centennial Exposition
